# Introduction

# Data 

These data came from open data toronto.....

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
crime <- read_csv("neighbourhood-crime-rates.csv")
```

```{r}
dbe <- crime %>% 
  select(Neighbourhood, Hood_ID, BreakAndEnter_Rate2014:BreakAndEnter_Rate2020)

```

The mean and standard deviation rate of break and entering in 2019 is shown in the table below. 

```{r}
dbe %>% 
  summarize(mean_be = mean(BreakAndEnter_Rate2019),
            sd_be = sd(BreakAndEnter_Rate2019))
```
